Description: Fragment of solid-cast headdress in copper alloy; sun-disc topped by high plumes of ostrich with incised details; fitting, or fragment, belonging to a figure of an Egyptian deity, perhaps Amun or Harpokrates; no tang preserved; lower part slightly broken; metal relatively well preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The two high feathers of ostrich (Shuti) are a component of various crowns worn by several Egyptian deities, such as Amun, Harpokrates or Horus (Weiss 2012, 31-34, 38-39, Abb. 3.6, 3.12 and 4.10a, see esp. Nr. 1316 for this specimen). Weiss, K. 2012, Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten : Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland, Ägypten und Altes Testament 81.
Bibliographic references: Weiss 2012 / Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten : Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland (p. 866, Nr. 1316)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.224) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
